intro: Lesquerella argyraea subsp. diffusa, commonly known as the silverleaf lesquerella, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces seeds that are used in the production of natural oils, making it valuable in industrial and cosmetic applications. The subspecies diffusa is distinguished by its more diffuse growth habit compared to other subspecies of Lesquerella.
